column5: I was just on Facebook and saw this. Can any locals confirm it? We are headed to Red Lake Saturday so trying keep updated on all road Conditions!!!!
It sounds true, as my wife reported a flagging person standing at the junction of 105 and 17 tonight.
It's true,...... updates on conditions for highways are available on line at, ontario.ca/511........ Looks like they are calling for showers the next couple of days. Mike
don't worry Joe, you can come up by using the detour. the ckdr.net web site tells us it's a 17 km detour. just to get you by the flooded area.
Been driving through the the flooded section all week going and coming from work.today its 13" deep.no problem for half tons but would take the detour with a car.
Is the detour paved or gravel?

Drive on up 105.....unless you own a car. We took 3 trucks and a conversion van thru it today around 10:30am about 10-12" water as stated they had flaggers on each side and the lady at 105/17 corner said if you have a car recommend the detour. I took a go pro clip of us going thru kind of cool. Go slow n stay in the middle and you will be fine!
